metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15917 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
common/session.c in Claws Mail before 3.17.6 has a protocol violation because suffix data after STARTTLS is mishandled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-15917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

claws-mail - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-acpi-notifier - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-address-keeper - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-archiver-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-attach-remover - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-attach-warner - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-bogofilter - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-bsfilter-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-clamd-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-dillo-viewer - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-extra-plugins - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-feeds-reader - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-fetchinfo-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-gdata-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-i18n - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-libravatar - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-litehtml-viewer - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-mailmbox-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-managesieve - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-multi-notifier - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-newmail-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-pdf-viewer - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-perl-filter - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-pgpinline - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-pgpmime - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-plugins - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-smime-plugin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-spam-report - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-spamassassin - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-tnef-parser - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-tools - 3.17.6-1
claws-mail-vcalendar-plugin - 3.17.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: claws-mail package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.17.6-1').
